theater

Class Play<P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • theater.Play<P>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Query.QueryPlay, TransportPlay

    public abstract class Play<P>
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    rongomai

    • Nested Class Summary

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  Play.Character<A extends Actor<P>>
      Implements a representation of a character in a play.
      private static class  Play.LoopFoundException
      A private exception for catching loops in the running graph.
      protected class  Play.StatelessCharacter
      A character that uses Actor directly, i.e., has no internal state.

    • Field Detail

      • protocolName

        protected java.lang.String protocolName
        The name of the protocol implemented by the class. Should preferably be overridden.

      • timeout

        protected final int timeout
        The maximum amount time each participant will stay processing a run.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • actorClasses

        private final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<?>> actorClasses
        The mapping from character to the Actor class it uses.

      • flowchart

        private Flowchart flowchart
        The automaton describing all the actions in the network. Be careful: since some actions may take place asynchronously, this automaton is only a representative of its equivalence class.

      • causality

        private Causality causality
        The object describing the causality and bifurcations relations in the protocol. It is used to determine the maximum timeouts for messages.

      • searchStack

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.util.ArrayList<Outcome>> searchStack
        A modified stack that records not the nodes to be explored, but the path that leads to them. This is necessary, since the code needs to know how to drive the function to get there when the search backtracks.

      • lastNodeStack

        private java.util.LinkedList<Node> lastNodeStack
        The standard, normal search stack.

      • tipsStack

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Tip>> tipsStack
        The stack used to track tips configurations at every step.

      • exploredNodes

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,Node> exploredNodes

      • decisionList

        private java.util.ArrayList<Outcome> decisionList
        Current path to the node.

      • listIndex

        private int listIndex

      • lastNode

        private Node lastNode
        The last node explored.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Play

        protected Play()
        Protected empty constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • dramatisPersonae

        public abstract void dramatisPersonae()
        This method declares all characters that act in the play.

      • scene

        public abstract void scene()
        This method describes how characters interact with each other. The execution of the actions listed might be asynchronous, but must always be causal. The actual execution might happen in a different order, but this order will belong to the same equivalence class that the description given in this function.

      • getProtocolName

        public final java.lang.String getProtocolName()
        Get the name of the protocol implemented by this class.
        Returns:
        a string uniquely identifying the protocol.

      • interpretAs

        public final Part interpretAs(java.lang.String mainCharacter)
        Explores the method scene and builds a graph of the calls to send, run and test. The problem with this search is that, since we are searching running code, every time we want to backtrack, we need to throw an exception and start all over again until we get to the point we should get to. It seems that DFS is the best search to handle this inconvenient, but that still remains to be proved.
        Parameters:
        mainCharacter - the character the program has to enact.

      • getFlowchart

        private Flowchart getFlowchart()
        Builds the flowchart. This method is the one that actually does all the fun stuff.
        Returns:
        the flowchart defined by the class.

      • onSearch

        private java.lang.Boolean onSearch(java.lang.Object fullName,
                                   java.util.function.Supplier<Outcome> action)
        A method to be called during the search to manage all the search overhead. What it basically does is to avoid the action from being executed in case the search is in backtracking mode (remember: this is not a normal graph and this is not a normal search.).
        Parameters:
        fullName - an unique identifier to the function call. This is the parameter used to discover in which state of execution we are.
        action - the action to be executed during the search (pretending it is a normal search).
        Returns:
        the effect of the function call (it might also be throwing an exception), but never mind what that means...
        See Also:
        leaveForLater(Node, Outcome, Map)

      • leaveForLater

        private void leaveForLater(Node node,
                           Outcome futureOutcome,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Tip> newTips)
        Inscribes a node to be visited later in the search with a different outcome than the one passed to onSearch(Object, Supplier). This is used as the mechanism to put the yet unexplored adjacencies of the node in the search.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node
        futureOutcome - the yet unexplored outcome for that node.
        newTips - the set of tips in the Causality graph to be used in the context to be explored.
        See Also:
        onSearch(Object, Supplier)

      • declareNode

        private void declareNode(Node node,
                         java.lang.Object fullName)
        Declares a new node to the search. This inscribes the node in the explored set and gives it a fullName, which distinguishes it from other nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - the new node found in the search.
        fullName - a unique identifier for this node.
        See Also:
        onSearch(Object, Supplier)

      • enact

        protected final void enact(Play<P> play,
                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> cast,
                           java.lang.String prefix)
        Enacts another play translating the character names with the map structure given. An optional parameter, prefix, is given to avid potential namespace clashes. It is recommended not to omit it. Please note that the cast must be valid. That is, the actors in this play should be castable to the actors associated in the play to be enacted. (Warning: not debugged yet).
        Parameters:
        play - the play to be enacted.
        cast - a valid translation from characters in the other play to characters in this play.
        prefix - a prefix to be applied to all messages in the play to be enacted.
